section.p: Captures Procedures performed for the patient. Could be an encounter or actual service not clinically related i.e. CWT, compensatory thearapy work that the patient was being paid for.

ol.li:
Contains exactly one [1..1] id with data type Id
Unique Identifier for the EventCapture for the Patient
Contains exactly one [1..1] checkoutTime with data type Point In Time

Contains exactly one [1..1] eventCaptureCategory with data type Code
Identfies the procedure code type that determines whether this is a uses the CPT or the NAtional Procedure codeSet
Contains exactly one [1..1] isInpatient with data type Boolean

Contains exactly one [1..1] nbrOfProcedures with data type Integer Interval
Contains the number of times the designated procedure was performed on the patient.

Contains exactly one [1..1] procedureDate with data type Point In Time
Date/Time of procedure/service performed.

Contains exactly one [1..1] procedureModifierText with data type String
Captures Procedures performed for the patient. Could be an encounter or actual service not clinically related i.e. CWT, compensatory thearapy work that the patient was being paid for.

Contains exactly one [1..1] procedureReason with data type Code
Contains the codeset for the Reason for the procedure.

Contains exactly one [1..1] clinic, where its type is Hospital Location
"A facility, often associated with a hospital or medical school, that is devoted to the diagnosis and care of outpatients." The American Heritage Stedman's Medical Dictionary
Contains zero or one [0..1] dssId, where its type is Clinic Stop

Contains exactly one [1..1] dssUnit, where its type is Dss Unit
Establishes the Unit id information for the Faciility entering information into the Event Capture
Contains exactly one [1..1] location, where its type is Institution
Contains exactly one [1..1] orderingSection, where its type is Medical Specialty

Contains exactly one [1..1] primaryDiagnosis, where its type is Diagnosis
The act or process of identifying or determining the nature and cause of a disease or injury through evaluation of patient history, examination, and review of laboratory data.
The act or process of identifying or determining the nature and cause of a disease or injury through evaluation of patient history, examination, and review of laboratory data.
Contains zero or one [0..1] procedure1, where its type is Procedure
Contains zero or one [0..1] procedure2, where its type is National Procedure
Contains zero or one [0..1] secondaryDiagnosis, where its type is Diagnosis
Contains exactly one [1..1] section, where its type is Medical Specialty
Contains exactly one [1..1] service, where its type is Service Department
Contains exactly one [1..1] visit, where its type is Outpatient Visit
Contains exactly one [1..1] patient, where its type is Patient
